# TidyTuesday


```{r setup, include=FALSE}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(stringr) # to capitalize counties
library(forcats) # for factoring county categories
library(showtext) # for adding google font
library(ragg) # for agg_png function; draw to a PNG file

# open showtext
showtext_opts(dpi = 300)
showtext_auto(enable = TRUE)
```

# Load the weekly Data

```{r Load}

tt <- tt_load("2021-01-19")

```


# Readme

```{r Readme, eval = interactive()}

tt

```


# Pull Data

```{r Glimpse}

crops <- tt$crops

```

# Wrangle

```{r Wrangle}

crops2 <- crops %>%
  
  # remove Kenya
  filter(SubCounty != "KENYA") %>%
  
  #pivot to long format
  pivot_longer(cols = Farming:`Khat (Miraa)`, names_to = "crop" ) %>%
  
  # group by crop and find percentage of each crops grown at the SubCounty
  group_by(crop) %>%
  mutate(percentage = value/sum(value, na.rm = T) * 100) %>%
  ungroup()

# capitalize first letter only
crops2$SubCounty <- stringr::str_to_title(crops2$SubCounty)

# arrange descending (important for order of appearance)
crops2 <- crops2 %>%
  arrange(desc(SubCounty))
```


# Visualize

```{r Visualize}

# add google fonts
font_add_google(name = "Lustria", family = "one")
font_add_google(name = "Nunito", family = "two")


# save my colors
l_grey <- "#a6a6a6"
d_grey <- "#222222"
white <- "#FFFFFF"
l_lilac <- "#fbf6fc"
lilac <- "#B65FCF"

# customize theme
my_theme <- theme(
  
  # title
  plot.title = element_text(family = "one", size = 20, hjust = .5, color = d_grey, margin = margin(10, 0, 15, 0)),
  
  # subtitle
  plot.subtitle = element_text(family = "one", size = 14, hjust = .5, color = d_grey, margin = margin(0, 0, 15, 0)),
  
  # caption
  plot.caption = element_text(family = "one", size = 10, hjust = .5, color = l_grey, margin = margin(15, 0, 10, 0)),
  
  # axis
  axis.text = element_text(family = "one", size = 10, color = d_grey),
  axis.title = element_text(family = "one", size = 10, color = d_grey),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
  
  # plot background
  panel.background = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#FFFFFF")
)

# create plot
my_plot <- crops2 %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = crop, fct_inorder(SubCounty))) +
  
  # add heat map
  geom_tile(aes(fill = percentage), width = 0.7, height = 0.7, color = l_grey) +
  
  # add labels
  geom_text(aes(family = "two", label = (round(percentage, 1))), size = 3) +
  
  # scales
  scale_x_discrete(position = "top") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = l_lilac, high = lilac, na.value = 'white', guide = FALSE) +

  # labs
  labs(title = "2019 Census: Crop Growth in Kenya by Type and County",
       subtitle = "For each crop, the numbers represent the percentage of households in the county \ngrowing the crop. If data are not available, white blanks are used.",
       caption = "Design: Jackie Torres | Data Source: rKenyaCensus by Shelmith Kariuki | #TidyTuesday 2021W4",
       x = NULL,
       y = NULL) +
  
  # use my theme
  my_theme

# save image
ggsave("my_plot.png",
       plot = my_plot,
       device = agg_png(width = 10, height = 10, units = "in", res = 300))

dev.off()

```
